subtitulo: I'm a communication professional focused on digital content

experiencias.cargo: Director of Digital Content, Influencer Marketing and Talent

blocks.title: Podcast Passion 4 Jazz
blocks.paragraph:
Passion 4 Jazz is a digital platform for jazz enthusiasts, whether they already have extensive knowledge or are just beginning to explore the genre. With a diverse team, we developed a full season of eight episodes focused on the most important names and icons in jazz—from its origins to the present day—covering all its facets.

The production included concept development, research and scripting, casting, art direction, set design and props, lighting, filming, sound production, and audio/video editing. It also encompassed a content strategy and a promotional package.

We developed all the soundtracks and sonic branding in collaboration with Gustavo Bugni, a seasoned music professional with extensive experience in jazz. Although this is a project with a strong focus on audio, we recognize that graphic design enhances the experience and stimulates the senses even further. Therefore, we created a visual package to express the essence of the Passion 4 Jazz platform.

In addition to delivering the podcast in MP3 format and its graphic package, we also included a set of video and image assets to promote the project. Each episode is supported by greeting videos for social media, highlight reels featuring memorable moments, and behind-the-scenes photo albums.

blocks.title: PLAYGROUND - Creative Agency | NATURA
blocks.paragraph:
In 2021, we began a partnership with Africa agency to serve Natura as the creative agency, focusing on social media content. Month after month we delivered content packages for the Tododia line, highlighting the main characteristics of the fragrances most loved by consumers, with strong emphasis on texture, sensations, and emotions.

Content production included casting with a three-model cast, plus wardrobe, art direction and props. The graphics package was an extension of the brand guidelines.

blocks.title: PLAYGROUND - Creative Agency | NETFLIX
blocks.paragraph: As production and content manager, I led the creative team in developing formats for Netflix’s social channels. Production included developing digital content from concept through scriptwriting, graphic package, sound and video editing, and promotional assets. The content strategy was based on data analysis from the brand’s platforms, considering audience engagement and retention.

blocks.title: Worlds Collide | NETFLIX
blocks.paragraph:
An original six-episode YouTube series designed to cross-relate shows and present new titles to the brand’s audience. We created a narrative full of theories that connected catalog titles, forming a Netflix cinematic universe.

The result was high fan engagement, with comments that expanded on the theories and increased channel retention.

blocks.title: HAVAIANAS + NETFLIX | Follow My Voice (International Women’s Day)
blocks.paragraph:
For International Women’s Day, we kicked off a production partnership with Havaianas and Netflix. Both brands came together to launch a product inspired by the female leadership in Netflix series. But there was a challenge: how do we start this conversation without distancing real people from the superheroes’ powers?

So we created the Follow My Voice campaign, a platform where real women share their stories of victories and achievements—real powers from extremely strong people. To start this conversation, we brought together four women who have everything to do with Netflix’s protagonists.

blocks.title: 3 LANGUAGES, MULTIPLE PLATFORMS
blocks.paragraph: The entire campaign was created in three languages, preserving the originality and Brazilian creativity that expresses what HAVAIANAS is around the world.

blocks.title: BOHEMIA | Flavor that Moves Traditions
blocks.paragraph:
In a series format with different approaches, the goal was to show that Brazil’s first brewery remains as current as many other traditions in our country, such as Northeastern São João and Rio’s passinho.

Even during the pandemic, we brought together different personalities from these traditions to share their views and expand the conversations around the brand. As production and content manager, my role was to lead the creative and production teams in developing the brand’s digital presence through localized content for different platforms.

This production included scripting, pre- and post-production, remote capture, cast preparation, development of a graphic package based on concept art, motion design, and a promotional package.

blocks.title: PlayGround - Branded Content | NESTLÉ
blocks.paragraph:
Starting in January 2020 I joined the PlayGround Brasil team as production and project manager. Responsible for editorial content, but also branded content, I took on challenges not only from our creative team but also from our clients.

As production and project manager, I am responsible for developing content proposals that are effective and efficient for our clients and their brands—and also for PlayGround as a company, since branded content is one of our main business models. In addition to developing proposals with the commercial and editorial teams, I also manage production budgets, contract development, and production schedules, among other responsibilities.

blocks.title: Emergency Kitchen | NESTLÉ
blocks.paragraph:
Focusing on practical recipes and everyday emergencies, we developed a pilot project with Nestlé aimed at younger audiences. What do you do when there’s only water in the fridge? How do you give yourself a little comfort when Mercury is in retrograde? How do you cook something cool for an unexpected date?

The content campaign included four main, full videos, each with three recipes. To increase reach, we created shorter assets with calls to action to tease and invite the audience to the main video. This is an example made for Instagram Reels.

blocks.title: Masters’ Talk | NESCAFÉ
blocks.paragraph:
To promote its premium coffee brand, we developed with Nestlé a roundtable among women masters behind three beloved beverages: coffee, wine and beer.

At the height of the pandemic, we created a remote switcher to direct high-quality capture in three different environments. This allowed each master to share her experiences not only with the beverages but also in professional fields rarely occupied by women.

The content campaign featured one main video and short promotional teasers, all adapted for different platforms. This production included: development of an original editorial concept, casting, graphic package, script development, culinary curation, pre- and post-production, remote capture, art direction and props, photoshoot, lighting and motion.

blocks.title: INTIMUS (Kotex) - End the Stigma (Stigma Box) | BRANDED CONTENT
blocks.paragraph:
We developed a branded content partnership with Intimus to bring a discussion about menstruation and its stigmas to our audience, aiming to better inform people about everyday prejudices and misinformation on the topic—humanizing it through the experiences of real people.

With an extensive content calendar, we explored various media formats and storytelling, starting with informational videos and social experiments in which women demystified the subject alongside men in their lives. We also included content created by the audience itself, who sent us their most controversial cases to be turned into animations.

Production took place at the beginning of the pandemic, which required adjustments to some pre-approved formats with the client, considering the new reality.

This production included: adapting the client’s concept into new and existing formats, casting and voiceover, script development, graphic arts and motion package, art direction, remote capture, animation, curation of user-generated content, and pre- and post-production.

blocks.title: Toilets Change Lives | NEVE
blocks.paragraph:
As PlayGround Brasil’s production and project manager, I was responsible for developing strategic content proposals for brands whose values align with ours and that resonate with the audience.

We partnered with Kimberly-Clark and its product Neve with the mission of telling Brazil about the outcome of localizing the global campaign Toilets Change Lives. After developing initiatives with NGOs that carry out basic sanitation work for hard-to-reach populations, the brand wanted to communicate the results nationwide through digital platforms.

blocks.title: A new challenge
blocks.paragraph:
After completing the campaign with the NGOs and being ready to communicate the results, the pandemic changed all of the brand’s plans. How could we show the concrete impact of its actions with vulnerable, hard-to-reach populations during the most restrictive moment in recent history?

PlayGround joined Kimberly-Clark in the search for viable solutions. We established a content strategy focused on a wide calendar with various informational pieces culminating in the release of a short documentary on the brand’s YouTube channel. The documentary brought together pre-captured footage, remote interviews, and on-site captures made by a small crew, following all health and hygiene protocols in different regions of the country (Northeast, Southeast and Center-West).

With the implementation of the on-the-ground solutions postponed, we introduced animations that helped visualize in video what had been delayed in real life.

This production included: development of strategic content based on the client’s initiatives; development of a graphic package based on the client’s identity; script development; remote and on-site capture; casting of talent and subject matter experts; animations and motion design; and pre- and post-production.

blocks.title: PlayGround | Editorial Content
blocks.paragraph: Starting in January 2020, I became part of the PlayGround Brasil team as Production Manager. In 2021, I took over content and the general management of the company in Brazil. Along the way, I was responsible for branded content as well as editorial content—tailored to different networks and platforms.

blocks.title: Pq Deu Certo? | SERIES
blocks.paragraph: An explainer-format series hosted by podcaster Laurinha Lero. As Producer and Director, I worked on schedule management, pre-production, production and post-production. I was responsible for budget management, talent contracts, crew scheduling, set dressing and interviews, managing talent, and script development.

blocks.title: Great Debates of Humanity | SERIES
blocks.paragraph: The series proposes digestible debates on sometimes controversial topics. It is presented by Thiago Ora, a content creator who balances pop culture with philosophy. As Producer and Director, I handled the organization of pre-production, production and post-production schedules, talent and content management, as well as budget management, contracts and art production.

blocks.title: Playground | Facebook, Instagram and TikTok Feeds
blocks.paragraph:
In addition to special series, I was also responsible for producing videos and other special content for PlayGround Brasil’s Facebook, Instagram and TikTok feeds.

These tasks included budget management; pre-production, production and post-production schedules; talent, crew and equipment management; and script approval.

blocks.title: PlayGround Interview | Production and Content Manager
blocks.paragraph:
Playground Interview is a biweekly remote interview format developed during the 2020 pandemic.

There was the editorial challenge of generating relevant content for the audience at a time of isolation and social distancing. What many could see as an obstacle turned into a great opportunity—on a global scale.

Artists and personalities were isolated at home, still learning to deal with the new reality while continuing to produce. Logistics were solved—no one needed to visit a studio anymore. With a solid rundown, plenty of technology and communication software like Zoom or Skype, our super creative team started booking interviews and telling stories.

We premiered with Pabllo Vittar, but also talked to Spice Girl Mel C, Laerte Coutinho, Mauricio de Sousa, as well as Fernanda Takai, and the cast and production of the film Alice Junior, among others.

In this project I was involved from format creation to graphics package development, talent selection and remote capture. I am credited as Producer and Director. In some editions I was responsible for the rundown, conducting the interview and the script.

blocks.title: In Front of the Wall | STRATEGY
blocks.paragraph:
The In Front Of The Wall strategy for the A&E, History, History 2 and Lifetime brands consists of sharing with everyday users a sample of the brands’ power as content producers—without requiring a platform login or being a pay-TV customer.

New titles (full episodes) are added monthly to the brands’ VOD platforms, focusing on owned environments (brand sites), YouTube and Dailymotion. The strategy has driven growth across all platforms, but YouTube is where it thrives most—and where the experiment began.

A comparison between periods before and after the IFTW Strategy shows steep growth in the brand’s main YouTube KPIs:

Total hours watched: +896%
Average view duration: +213%
Video views: +419%
Revenue: +634%
New channel subscribers: +517%

By publishing longer content, the channel gains more relevance on the platform and performs better in SEO rankings. This applies not only to Google’s search engine, but also to YouTube itself and other internal tools, such as related video suggestions (in-video) and menus on the platform’s internal pages.

The result is extremely positive.

blocks.title: Desafio Sob Fogo LatAm | YOUTUBE STRATEGY
blocks.paragraph:
A strategy focused on digital performance, supporting TV viewership through YouTube catch-up (missed an episode? Watch it on YouTube). The use of best practices combined with strategic tagging and monitoring of owned and competitor content led the project to success.

- +2.5 million video views per month
- +230% increase in the channel’s average ATS
- Accelerated growth of the fan base and monetization indicators

In addition to publishing full episodes, weekly videos were released to expand the user experience. That way, viewers got to know the contestant representing Brazil in the series.
They were able to ask questions:
They could visit the contestant’s workshop:
They discovered the secrets that led TOM SILVA to success:
And they were moved by the human side:
They also got to have fun with him and with the reality show host, the Colombian JUAN PABLO LLANO:

The steady output of series-related videos, combined with a keyword strategy and consistent publishing cadence, led to dominance in search for key segment terms, both on Google and on YouTube.

The strategy was paired with publishing full episodes. Results: 2.5M views/month, increased TV viewership, and higher relevance of the channel on the platform itself.

blocks.title: Portal R7 | Ídolos, A Fazenda and Aprendiz Online
blocks.paragraph:
Between 2010 and 2011, I was a content producer in the video department of the R7 portal at Rede Record. During that period, I produced content for the digital platforms of the network’s top shows, such as the reality series A Fazenda, O Aprendiz and Ídolos.

Coverage took place 24/7 on social networks and, mainly, on Rede Record’s portal, R7.com.

blocks.title: SOCIAL TV: TV on two screens | Panel Moderator
blocks.paragraph: I moderated and presented information about Social TV on a 45-minute panel during Campus Party Brasil, in its sixth edition (2013). With the participation of Nilson Xavier (Teledramaturgia), Lele Siedschlag (Te Dou Um Dado) and Alex Medeiros (TV Globo), we discussed the reality of Brazilian TV in the face of new trends brought by social networks.

blocks.title: Twitter Moments & Social TV
blocks.paragraph: Twitter Moments is one of Twitter’s many native tools and was used strategically to grow the fan base and engagement, in collaboration with Twitter’s São Paulo office. Twitter Moments allows creators to start or join online conversations happening in real time. As content creators, History and A&E took part with a wide variety of examples.

blocks.title: Twitter Moments related to Today in History
blocks.paragraph: Today in History is one of the best examples of native social content from our brands. It began as a daily post format celebrating past events that happened on that date. As engagement grew, it was adapted to other networks, always respecting each network’s language. Twitter Moments became the best way to adapt Today in History for Twitter. That’s how we did it: talking about odd facts and internet culture, presenting quizzes about events that marked the day, celebrating pop culture, remembering figures from the past, and testing our fans’ knowledge, among other things.

blocks.title: Twitter Moments related to News
blocks.paragraph: We also adapted news originally produced for the History and A&E channel websites, through lists of curiosities, oddities, discoveries, theories, galleries with intriguing images, and other formats.

blocks.title: Twitter Moments related to promoting New Series
blocks.paragraph:
We also promoted our series by generating audience through captivating conversations. In this case, we promoted the new miniseries Roots with a list of racist terms people use without even realizing it. We used the same technique to promote new episodes of another series for a week. That series covered different ways the world could end. Have you ever imagined what would happen to the planet after the start of a nuclear war? Or what would happen if our planet collided with another? What if a giant solar storm hit Earth? Worse yet: what would happen after an alien invasion? We imagined all of that. And if those hypotheses weren’t enough, we still considered six other ways the world could end.

These pieces were presented as complementary content to the episodes, released day by day, Monday through Friday. During one of President Michel Temer’s speeches—after being charged by the Federal Police—the main character of the series Bull analyzed his facial expressions. Our fans had the chance to guess what each expression meant.

By linking popular discussions to Bull’s core themes, we promoted the series by actively participating in the conversations happening online.

blocks.title: Results
blocks.paragraph: 240% growth in the fan base in less than five months, with triple the reach and engagement—without any paid media investment.
The spikes occurred on the days we published Twitter Moments.

blocks.title: TV Cultura | Digital Content Producer
blocks.paragraph: I worked at TV Cultura, in the Digital Department, between 2009 and 2010. I took part in the productions Programa Novo and Login, always creating content connected to internet topics, especially social networks.

blocks.title: Programa Novo | Digital Correspondent
blocks.paragraph: On the Programa Novo production, I participated as a digital correspondent—or rather, as a blogger who represented the show on social media and connected the audience with what was new online through TV segments. My role was to share what was trending on social networks, as well as administer and manage the show’s official profiles.

blocks.title: Programa Login | Digital Content Producer
blocks.paragraph: In the production of LOGIN, aimed at Generation Y youth, I worked as a base producer. I created characters for the segment "Perfil Y," which showcased young people from this generation, translating and capturing all their dreams, aspirations, and expectations on video.

blocks.title: Ex Tricô and Tricô dos Bróder | Digital Producer
blocks.paragraph:
In addition to producing digital content for major Rede Record series, between 2010 and 2011 I was also the producer of exclusive digital properties, such as the interview show Tricô dos Bróder, which later evolved into Ex Tricô. The show was hosted by Lele Siedschlag (Te Dou um Dado) and Clara Averbuck.

This daily feature on the R7 portal presented interviews with participants from the reality show Big Brother Brasil, as well as commentary from the hosts on the most relevant events from the show. When Big Brother was off the air, the program focused on web celebrities, minor celebrities, and trending internet topics.

blocks.title: Alone | History Channel
blocks.paragraph:
In this campaign, I was responsible not only for localizing assets shared by the corporate headquarters, but also for overseeing content creation for Latin America.

Sozinhos is a TV series that performs slightly better in the Brazilian domestic market. Therefore, it was a priority for our region. The main goal of the campaign was to generate awareness and drive tune-in.

We identified potential audience segments and worked with exclusive content for social media, reaching these groups through a targeted dark post campaign on Facebook.

blocks.title: Social Media Content
blocks.paragraph:
- The first season of the series is set in Patagonia, a region in South America. We leveraged this information to promote the show through creative assets that highlight the new setting, which is part of our market and resonates strongly with our audience.

- The new setting was also showcased through immersive 360º photos.

- This is the first season to feature women in the cast. We saw this as an opportunity to engage with female audiences and reinforce themes related to women's empowerment.

- All digital creatives were fully aligned with the out-of-home media campaign assets.

- The strategy included exclusive content tailored to each platform. A highlight was the content on Twitter, using Twitter Moments. Examples include: The Dangers of Patagonia and Survival Tips.

blocks.title: Digital Strategy for Promotion and Support of the Giorgio in Brazil Event
blocks.paragraph: On August 26, HISTORY welcomed fans of the series Ancient Aliens to a special event featuring an exclusive screening of a new episode from the latest season, followed by a live discussion with talent GIORGIO TSOUKALOS.
The event also featured a cosplay contest, VIP Meet & Greet sessions, and live broadcasts via Facebook and YouTube Live across Brazil.

blocks.title: Event Highlights and Metrics
blocks.paragraph:
- 710 tickets distributed in less than one hour via the digital platform EventBrite

- Average of 1,300 viewers during the Facebook Live broadcast, peaking at 1,500

- 1.7 million people followed the campaign’s live streams on Facebook

- The #GiorgioNoBrasil debate broadcast alone reached 1.06 million unique users organically on Facebook

- #GiorgioNoBrasil trended in São Paulo’s Twitter Trending Topics throughout the event

- 7.8 million unique users reached organically on Twitter

- #GiorgioNoBrasil post campaign reached 2.3 million unique users organically

- 454 Instagram posts using the hashtag #GiorgioNoBrasil

These strong social media results reflect a well-executed digital strategy. One key initiative was a partnership with Flowics, which displayed posts using the hashtag #GiorgioNoBrasil on large screens throughout the event and as lower-thirds during the live panel broadcast on Facebook and YouTube Live.

Another impactful action was inviting digital influencers, who had access to a special area and an exclusive Meet & Greet, where they met Giorgio and took photos with him.

blocks.title: Broadcasts via Facebook and Youtube Live
blocks.paragraph: Guests joined via Facebook and Youtube Live.

blocks.title: Press Conference and Social Media Content #GiorgioNoBrasil
blocks.paragraph:
Press event in collaboration with the Public Relations department, with a focus on digital influencers.

By strategically offering audiovisual content capture, we ensured full media presence and the creation of diverse content across social platforms.

blocks.title: Content Created by Select Digital Influencers and Press
Exclusive Content Created for History Channel’s Social Media
blocks.paragraph:
Exclusive broadcast featuring a special guest to promote the #GiorgioNoBrasil event and the new season of the series Ancient Aliens.

The interview was hosted by Afonso Tresdê, a digital influencer specializing in ufology, who has a strong connection with the channel’s audience.

blocks.title: Social Media Actions
blocks.paragraph: To generate engagement around the talent’s first visit to the country, we invited fans to submit questions about Giorgio’s area of expertise: the Ancient Astronaut Theory. The audience response was overwhelming.
We also put together an exclusive Twitter Moments with the talent. This piece brought together a sequential series of videos in which Giorgio talks about his life.
